intro: Reseda germanicopolitana var. germanicopolitana, commonly known as the Germanicopolitan knotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has linear, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to Europe and thrives in disturbed soils, often found along roadsides and in open fields. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and somewhat rare species within its native range.
